thread.title: Fan critically injured in fight outside Dodger Stadium
thread.title_full: Fan critically injured in fight outside Dodger Stadium - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Fan critically injured in fight outside Dodger Stadium
text:
Photo: Frazer Harrison, Getty Images Image 1 of / 3   3 A fan was injured in a fight outside Dodger Stadium after a playoff game last Friday night.

Photo: Frazer Harrison, Getty Images A fan was injured in a fight outside Dodger Stadium after a playoff... Image 2 of 3 Los Angeles Dodgers catcher Yasmani Grandal, right, and relief pitcher Kenley Jansen celebrate after their 5-2 win against the New York Mets in Game 2 of baseball's National League Division Series, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015 in Los Angeles.
Photo: Lenny Ignelzi, AP Los Angeles Dodgers catcher Yasmani Grandal, right, and relief... Image 3 of 3 An exterior view of Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles.
Photo: Stephen Dunn, Getty Images An exterior view of Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles. Fan critically injured in fight outside Dodger Stadium 1  /  3 Back to Gallery LOS ANGELES (AP) â€” Los Angeles police Chief Charlie Beck says two people involved in an assault outside Dodger Stadium that critically injured a baseball fan are believed to be a mother and son.
Beck said Tuesday that detectives had yet to interview the man who was injured late Friday after the Dodgers lost the opening game of the National League Division Series to the New York Mets .
The chief declined to discuss what may have led to the fight until the victim is interviewed, and he urged anyone who saw or recorded the incident to contact police.
Beck says stadium security has been significantly enhanced since a 2011 beating that left San Francisco Giants fan Bryan Stow with brain damage.
